tool.name: VCF masking : min and maximum depth

param.name: vcf_input
param.label: Upload your VCF file
param.help: File containing DNA sequence data in VCF format. You can upload a simple file, multiple files or a dataset collection.

param.name: MIN_DP
param.label: Minimum read depth (MIN_DP)
param.help: Minimum read depth (DP) per genotype required to retain it. Typical values depend on sequencing coverage: 1–5 for permissive filtering, 10–20 for standard filtering, and ≥30 for stringent filtering.

tool.help:
Usage ===== As input, the user provides one or more VCF files (Danecek *et al.* 2011) and a threshold value indicating a minimum read depth.
For each input VCF file, the tool replaces genotype calls with missing values (./.) if their depth (DP) is less than the user-defined minimum or exceeds a maximum threshold (automatically calculated as twice the average depth observed in the data file).
The tool automatically detects whether DP is stored in the INFO/DP or FORMAT/DP field of the VCF file. If no DP annotation is found, the input and output VCF files are identical.
Example: If the average depth in a VCF data file is 30 and the user sets a minimum threshold of 5, any genotype with DP < 5 or DP > 60 is considered missing data and masked.
Tips ==== The threshold values for minimum read depth depend on the objectives of the study. The minimum threshold is generally greater than 5 in order to avoid underestimating certain statistics, such as observed and expected heterozygosity (Kardos and Waples, 2024).
See also examples of VCF formats in : https://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/VCFv4.5.pdf
